_description: James Ryman, ‘Hostis Herodes impie’ — five quatrains with burden: Hostis herodes impie / Cristum venire quid times / Non eripit mortalia / Qui regna dat celestia

CULEe112.First Lines:
Wikked herode thou mortall fooThat criste shulde comme why dredest
                    thou soo…
CULEe112.Last Lines:
…With the fader and holy gostBothe iij & one of myghtis
                    moost
CULEe112.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius,
                        ed.  
             “Die Gedichte des Franziskaners Jacob Ryman.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         89 (1892): 167-338: 223-4.
Stevens,  John,
                        ed.  
             Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court.
         London: Methuen, 1961: 50 (4 stanzas only).
